title: SEO Events - MozMoz logoMenu openMenu closeSearchMoz logo
description: Your all-in-one suite of SEO essentials.
content: By: Jane Copland June 6, 2008 SMX Advanced - A View On Tone & Content SEO Events I always find it difficult to begin conference recaps. To me, they always sound trite. They're the high school English class equivalent of the forced short stories that begin, "We packed up the car to go to the beach..." Thus, my complaining about beginning conference recaps is how I've chosen to start this one. Luckily, there is plenty to talk about from SMX Advanced, and... Read this post V By: venice June 4, 2008 SEO Drink Buying Guide - Caffeine and Alcohol SEO Events After attending only a few SEO events and conferences it becomes apparent that search marketers like two things just about as much as they like links. Those two things are caffeine and alcohol, something you'll typically find in great abundance at your next search marketing event.Growing up in the food and beverage industry it's been second nature for me to pay attention to what ... Read this post C By: Ciaran Norris May 28, 2008 It's Not All Google: International Search Summit, London SEO Events Last week saw the inaugural International Search Summit, organised by Andy Atkins-Kruger's WebCertain. It was hosted to, as the name probably gives away, look at search marketing outside of the US & UK, which so often get all the attention of the industry. It also saw my first assignment as... Read this post By: Rebecca Kelley May 15, 2008 Thursday Roundup for the Week of 5/11/08 SEO Events Stories, news, and other notable items from the past week: Two star links: * The Industry Standard provides us with the 25 top B to Z-list blogs. Why am I giving the link 2-star status? Because the stupid site spaces the list out over multiple pages. ARGHHHHH. Take your page views and ad impressions and shove 'em up your arse. Read this post By: Rebecca Kelley May 8, 2008 Thursday Roundup for the Week of 5/4/08 SEO Events Stories, news, and other notable items from the past week: We've got star link Yahtzee today--a link for every star! Woo hoo, time to celebrate! Zero star link: * Mel showed me this, for lack of better words (and please excuse my French) fucked up WikiAnswers response to the question "How many people did Joseph Stalin kill?" Anyone care to improve the answer so that it's not batshit crazy and is instead at least passably objective? Anyone? Read this post K By: kellylarsen May 2, 2008 Your Chance to Win a FREE Conference Pass to Pay Per Click Summit SEO Events PPC Summit is Searching for the Best Search Marketing Strategy Contest We're calling all internet marketers to submit your proven most effective Search Marketing strategy or technique that increased your conversions! It's easy, go to the PPC Summit contest form here to submit your best practice: ... Read this post By: Rebecca Kelley May 1, 2008 Thursday Roundup for the Week of 4/27/08 SEO Events Stories, news, and other notable items from the past week: Two star links: * Regarding TechCrunch's "Is Keyword Search About to Hit its Breaking Point?" article, well, I'll quote what Rand said: "[S]uch a load of crap. Users have to change, not engines." Read this post S By: Stuart McIlreavy April 23, 2008 Chris Sherman SMX China Key Note: Search 3.0, Search 4.0 and Beyond SEO Events The Vibe:The crystal ballroom of the Xianglu Grand Hotel was at full attendance for Chris Sherman’s key note at SMX China. All attendees were equipped with headphones and transmitters for live translation. It was a treat to be part of such a cross cultural event. The Gist:Chris’s keynote was a broad overview of the new trends we are seeing introduce... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin April 21, 2008 Lessons from the Domain Roundtable SEO Events Yesterday I sepnt the day in San Francisco at the Domain Roundtable hosted by Jay Westerdal and DomainTools.com (BTW - they've got brilliant tools over there). Since I'm swamped with travel, building decks and trying to find SEOmoz some new office space, I figured I'd just use the ol' bullet point list. What... Read this post By: Jane Copland April 18, 2008 SMX Sydney, Auckland New Zealand & Some "Overheard" Gems SEO Events Hello, SEOmoz readers. My name is Jane and I work here. You may remember me from posts that were written about two weeks ago. I've been pretty quiet recently (the Moz Points are suffering) because I've been at the first SMX show in Australia. Rand already wrote about the show, but I thought I'd share my take on the conference and provide a short "overheard" as well. At the... Read this post By: Rebecca Kelley April 17, 2008 Thursday Roundup for the Week of 4/13/08 SEO Events Stories, news, and other notable items from the past week: The links are a bit scant this week due to being super busy and Rand being out of town. Special thanks to David Lindop for providing me with some nice roundup link suggestions. Thanks, David! Read this post By: Rand Fishkin April 12, 2008 Search Secrets Revealed, Amazing People Met, & Incredible Sites Seen at SMX Sydney SEO Events As SMX Sydney wound to a close on the north bank of Sydney harbor, I stood with new friends and old, eating shrimp off the barbie (no, really), drinking beer and staring at the incredible view of the Sydney Opera House & the Harbor Bridge. Was this the best conference I've ever attended? Quite possibly, yes (and that's saying a lot). ... Read this post By: Rebecca Kelley April 9, 2008 Retailer Expectations at Online Marketing Conferences SEO Events Yesterday I spoke at the Shop.org Online Marketing Workshop. I had previously spoken at a Shop.org summit in Las Vegas last September, and Larry Joseloff invited me and my fellow panelists back for another session. Our topic was "Keeping the Customers in Focus: Customer-Centric Search and Affiliate Marketing." Allan Dick from... Read this post By: Rebecca Kelley April 4, 2008 (Day After) Thursday Roundup for the Week of 3/30/08 SEO Events Yesterday I had my roundup all written and when I hit "Publish" the blog editor decided to just instead refresh and wipe half my post. Sorry for the delay--here you go. Stories, news, and other notable items from the past week: Read this post
